[b][color=white]Bytes Slot Machine[/color][/b]
On August 15th, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#9999FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] announced the release of the new [url=https://hackforums.net/slots.php][b]Bytes Slot Machine[/b][/url]. The bytes slot machine is a virtual slot machine on HF, which you can use with the newly introduced Bytes. Good luck everyone! [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5874294] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Mobale, A Mobile-Friendly Theme, In Beta Testing[/color][/b]
Head on over to UserCP -> [url=https://hackforums.net/usercp.php?action=options]Edit Options[/url] to try out the new and upcoming theme of Hack Forums, Mobale. It's still in heavy development which means there will be things out of place, missing, or completely broken. Please be patient while the team works on fixing them.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5876644] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[font=Trebuchet MS][size=medium]

[b][color=white]Delay[/color][/b]
Got busy with the theme, couldn't publish till now.

   
[/size][/font]
[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/t3vTOaj.png[/img][/align]
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=medium]

[b][color=white]India Introduces Free Healthcare for Poorest Citizens[/color][/b] 
For the lower five hundred million least wealthy of India's citizens, obtaining healthcare has always been an issue. India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi believes that healthcare is the most important factor in elevating the lowest income citizens. Each citizen will receive an annual budget of around $7,100 towards medical expenses. This will also massively aid India's hospitals which would commonly run out of beds for patients. This seems like a universally positive change for the country's budding economy. They are calling this new initiative "Modicare" after the acting Prime Minister. It is expected to cost India $1.7 billion dollars a year with options for further funding in subsequent years. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.newsweek.com/india-introducing-free-healthcare-500-million-people-1075607?utm_source=fark&utm_medium=website&utm_content=link&ICID=ref_fark]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Heatwave Uncovers Downed Airplane[/color][/b] 
As it turns out, global warming may have a positive. As a result of a recent heat wave, a frozen-over American C-53 Skytrooper has been discovered. The plane was entirely encased in ice in Switzerland. The American transport plane, known as Dakota was making a flight from Austra to Italy on November 18, 1946. A sudden-onset snowstorm forced the aircraft down and it is estimated that the plane collided with the ground going 174 miles per hour. Luckily all onboard were rescued soon after, but the aircraft remained frozen there for 72 years. [i][size=x-small][url=https://nationalpost.com/news/world/heatwave-thaws-swiss-glacier-uncovering-a-crashed-war-plane-hidden-for-72-years]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

   
[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3322334][img]https://i.imgur.com/H5MRIbN.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Get a Good Night's Sleep[/color][/b] 
Beauty sleep may be more important than any of us realize. A study published in Nature Communications from the University of California, Berkeley focuses on how lack of sleep can easily put us into this loop of depression. They grabbed eighteen participants and began testing them on sociability. Naturally, they were less likely to engage with others while being sleep deprived. The team also found in a companion study that people are generally less likely to attempt to interact with someone exhibiting traditional signs of loneliness. The authors have taken to calling the study “behavioral profile of social withdrawal and loneliness.” [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.inverse.com/article/48046-sleep-deprivation-leads-to-social-isolation-in-new-study]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Wheat Genome Sequenced[/color][/b] 
A task previously thought to be insurmountable; the entire wheat genome has been sequenced. This project took a global team thirteen years to pull off. Part of why this achievement is so noteworthy is that the wheat genome is not only larger than that of humans, it is also many times more complex. The team is hopeful that this feat could one day help isolate and treat wheat allergies in humans. That would surely be a giant leap forward for us as a species. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theguardian.com/science/2018/aug/16/scientists-sequence-wheat-genome-in-breakthrough-once-thought-impossible]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

    
[/size][/font]
